text: Monarchist Cause (, CM) was a political party in Portugal that supported to restoration of King Manuel II. ==History== The party was established in 1914.Douglas L. Wheeler (1999) Republican Portugal: A Political History, 1910-1926, Univ of Wisconsin Press, p258 It emerged as the second-largest party in the 1918 elections, which were boycotted by the main opposition parties.Dieter Nohlen & Philip Stöver (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, pp1557–1558 It failed to win a seat in the 1919 elections, but won four seats in the House of Representatives in the 1921 elections. The party went on to win 13 seats in the 1922 elections, but was reduced to seven seats in the 1925 elections. ==References== Category:Defunct political parties in Portugal Category:Political parties established in 1914 Category:1914 establishments in Portugal Category:Monarchist parties in Portugal Category:Political parties with year of disestablishment missing
title: Monarchist Cause
